intro: Matsumurella kwangtungensis, commonly known as the Guangdong matsumurella, is a species of flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its reproductive structures are adapted for wind pollination, which is common in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
